description: College-level biology problems covering molecular biology, genetics, evolution, and ecology. Master biological concepts through comprehensive practice questions and prepare for the AP Biology exam with detailed step-by-step solutions.

topics.name: Unit 1: Chemistry of Life
topics.description: Water properties, carbon chemistry, macromolecules (carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, nucleic acids), chemical bonds, and biological molecule structure-function relationships

topics.name: Unit 2: Cell Structure & Function
topics.description: Cell theory, prokaryotic vs eukaryotic cells, organelles and their functions, membrane structure, transport mechanisms (diffusion, osmosis, active transport), and cell size limitations

topics.name: Unit 3: Cellular Energetics
topics.description: Enzyme function and regulation, photosynthesis (light reactions, Calvin cycle), cellular respiration (glycolysis, Krebs cycle, electron transport chain), fermentation, and energy coupling

topics.name: Unit 4: Cell Communication
topics.description: Signal transduction pathways, cell signaling mechanisms, receptor types, second messengers, cell cycle regulation, and feedback mechanisms

topics.name: Unit 5: Review and Practice
topics.description: Comprehensive review of Units 1-4, integration of concepts, practice problems combining multiple topics, and midterm exam preparation

topics.name: Unit 6: Mendelian Genetics
topics.description: Meiosis, chromosome behavior, Mendel's laws (segregation, independent assortment), probability in genetics, pedigree analysis, and non-Mendelian inheritance patterns

topics.name: Unit 7: Molecular Genetics
topics.description: DNA structure and replication, transcription, translation, gene expression regulation, mutations, genetic code, and protein synthesis

topics.name: Unit 8: Biotechnology
topics.description: DNA technology, PCR, gel electrophoresis, genetic engineering, CRISPR, cloning, GMOs, genomics, bioinformatics, and ethical considerations

topics.name: Unit 9: Evolution
topics.description: Natural selection, evidence for evolution, population genetics, Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, speciation, phylogenetics, and evolutionary patterns

topics.name: Unit 10: Final Review
topics.description: Comprehensive integration of all units, AP exam-style questions, data analysis practice, experimental design, and test-taking strategies
